info

Class AbsoluteTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.AbsoluteTime

  • public class AbsoluteTime
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to interpret and manipulate Absolute Time field values. o Calendar dates o MJD dates

      • AbsoluteTime

        public AbsoluteTime(java.lang.String source)
        Construct a AbsoluteTime instance from the provided text representation. Supported Formats: o Year:DoY:Time - yyyy:DDD:HH:mm:ss[.SSS] o DateTime - yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss[.SSS]
        Parameters:
        source - Absolute time text representation

    • Method Detail

      • fixAbsTimeString

        public static java.lang.String fixAbsTimeString(java.lang.String value)
        Corrects the ATF value string which may/may not include the seconds portion Even though the string passes the pattern check, if the User enters a time with decimal seconds having more or less than 3 chars, this will not be interpreted correctly. Additionally, the calendar widget, when the User enters zero seconds, it is not included in the Parameter value: 2022-01-01T01:00:00.000 is returned as 2022-01-01T01:00 Rather than making more strict expressions, we are opting to screen the value and make adjustments as needed.
        Parameters:
        value - Date string to correct
        Returns:
        Date string with any needed corrections applied

      • fromMJD

        public static AbsoluteTime fromMJD(java.lang.Double mjd)
        Creates AbsoluteTime from provided MJD date.
        Parameters:
        mjd - MJD Date to convert
        Returns:
        AbsoluteTime instance corresponding to the provided MJD day.
